results.title: The Hoffnung symphony orchestra [B&W]
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Harold Whitaker, BBC-TV and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
A light hearted look at the various instruments of the orchestra, based on the original cartoons of the late Gerard Hoffnung, satirising musical pomposity. The music was composed and conducted by Francis Chagrin, who collaborated with Hoffnung on many occasions.

results.title: The Hoffnung Palm Court Orchestra
results.creator_credit: John Halas, British Broadcasting Corporation and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
It is the late 19th century in the lounge of an expensive hotel, where the Palm Court Orchestra is playing to a tea drinking audience. A fire starts and the hotel is soon ablaze, the people flee, but the orchestra plays on. In a series of other situations the orchestra also plays on. Based on a series of cartoon drawings by Gerard Hoffnung.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Halas, British Broadcasting Corporation and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: The Hoffnung music academy
results.creator_credit: John Halas, British Broadcasting Corporation and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
When the music professor rings his bell for his pupils, we take a trip round his Academy to see the various departments in action, including the piano deparment, folk music, military department and church music. Animated film based on the cartoon drawings of Gerard Hoffnung.

results.title: The Hoffnung maestro
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Harold Whitaker, BBC Enterprises and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
As the maestro conducts, a series of characters and situations express the varying moods of the music. Based on the drawings by Gerard Hoffnung. Credits include: storyboard and design by Tom Bailey; sound by Jack King; animation by Harold Whitaker and music by Francis Chagrin.

results.title: The Hobbit
results.creator_credit: Rankin-Bass Productions, Arthur Rankin Jnr and Jules Bass
results.brief_description: Bilbo Baggins journeys into the Middle Earth, a place inhabited by Elves, dwarves, Wizards, Goblins, Dragons and Hobbits in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King. It is an adventurous journey and a battle between the forces of Evil. This animated feature based on J.R.R. Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rankin-Bass Productions, Arthur Rankin Jnr and Jules Bass
results.description:
Bilbo Baggins journeys into Middle Earth, a place inhabited by elves, dwarves, wizards, goblins, dragons and hobbits, in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King.

It’s an adventurous journey that features a battle between the forces of good and evil. This animated feature based on JRR Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).
description_for_label:
Bilbo Baggins journeys into Middle Earth, a place inhabited by elves, dwarves, wizards, goblins, dragons and hobbits, in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King.

It’s an adventurous journey that features a battle between the forces of good and evil. This animated feature based on JRR Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).

results.title: The Hoarder
results.brief_description: A Birdland fantasy, by animation artist Evelyn Lambart, about a bluejay who takes whatever his beak can grasp and carry. Into his secret cache go berries, birds’ eggs, nests and all. Even the sun in the sky is unsafe from his consuming greed. But, as in her film Fine Feathers, there is a moral tucked away. The bluejay learns a lesson, and Birdland returns to normal. Suitable for primary school level
results.description: A Birdland fantasy, by animation artist Evelyn Lambart, about a bluejay who takes whatever his beak can grasp and carry. results.title: The Hitman
results.creator_credit: Gordon Chan, China Star HK Distribution Ltd and Tung Wai
results.brief_description: Following the assassination of a top Japanese Yakuza boss in Hong Kong, the most skilled hitmen assemble at a meeting held by the administrators of the dead man’s Revenge Fund, which promises $100 million for the head of the killer. One hopeful yet good-hearted hitman is Fu, a pennyless mainlander who accidentally walks into the meeting and is adopted by Ngok Lo, a con man agent for professional hitmen. Ngok Lo buys Fu new clothes and coaches him in the Hong Kong ways, proposing that Fu help him track down the killer so they can claim the bounty. In Cantonese with English subtitles. Cast includes: Jet Li, Eric Tsang, Simon Yam, Gigi Leung and Keiji Sato.

results.title: The Hitcher
results.creator_credit: Silver Screen Partners, David Bombyk, Kip Ohman and Robert Harmon
results.brief_description: This dark, violent suspense thriller centres around the strange psychological bond between a travelling serial killer and one of his intended victims. Travelling from Chicago to California, Jim Halsey narrowly escapes an accident when he falls asleep at the wheel. To help stay awake, he picks up hitchhiker, John Ryder, but soon discovers his error when Ryder threatens his life. Although Jim manages to escape, he is soon led on a game of cat-and-mouse across the Texas highways, where Ryder leaves a trail of corpses for Jim to discover. Cast includes Rutger Hauer, C. Thomas Howell, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Jeffrey de Munn.
